definition: to repeal (a law)/to put an end to/abolition/annulled
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste

sentences.english: The present system of reaping without sowing should cease immediately.
sentences.chinese: 目前這種不勞而獲的制度應當立即廢止。

sentences.english: China should further improve the law-abolishment system.
sentences.chinese: 我國宜進一步完善法的廢止制度。

sentences.english: In other words, these two disputing regulations would be better abolished as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 換言之，這兩項爭議的規定，寧及早廢止爲宜。

sentences.english: The abolition of foreign stereotypes was demanded in that report, yet some comrades are still promoting them.
sentences.chinese: 這裏叫洋八股廢止，有些同志卻實際上還在提倡。

sentences.english: The"Regulations of Shanghai Municipality on Administration of Underground Railway"shall be repealed at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 《上海市地下鐵道管理條例》同時廢止。

sentences.english: The revocation or renunciation of an agency may be made expressly or impliedly by conduct.
sentences.chinese: 廢止或斷絕代理，可以明示或暗示處理。

sentences.english: If war could be abolished, armies and navies would be unnecessary.
sentences.chinese: 如果戰爭可以廢止，陸軍和海軍就不再需要了。

sentences.english: The government has recently repealed a number of out-dated laws and regulations.
sentences.chinese: 政府最近廢止了一些過時的法律法規。

sentences.english: The democratic constitution, then loudly decried by many people, was abolished.
sentences.chinese: 民主憲法，被衆人高聲撻閥直至遭到廢止。

sentences.english: Many voted for the repeal of that property law.
sentences.chinese: 許多人投票贊成廢止那項財產法。

sentences.english: Corporal punishment must be abolished in trying criminals.
sentences.chinese: 審訊犯人時必須廢止肉刑。

sentences.english: Laws and even customs deemed to go against the country’s status as a republic are to be repealed.
sentences.chinese: 凡是與共和制不符的法規甚至習俗都將廢止。

sentences.english: In the meeting, he abolished or abrogated some laws.
sentences.chinese: 會議上，他廢止或廢除了一些法律。

sentences.english: These village regulations shall be annulled.
sentences.chinese: 這幾條村規民約應該廢止了。

sentences.english: The child retains the residence until it validly abandons it.
sentences.chinese: 未成年子女保有該住所直至合法廢止之。

sentences.english: The annulment caused a profound impression in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 同盟的廢止，在日本發生了強烈的反響。

definition: to issue/to proclaim/to enact (laws, decrees etc)
to recognize sth after the event/posthumous recognition/to ratify/to endorse retroactively
to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
to decide (in a meeting)/to resolve (i.e. pass a resolution)
Taiwanese variant of 奧巴馬|奥巴马[Ao4 ba1 ma3], Barack Obama (1961-), US Democrat politician, president 2009-2017
lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
to shut down/to terminate/to cancel/to go out of business
